item.title: US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy wants cancer warning on alcohol: How does your drinking habit cause cancer? - The Indian Express
item.description:
US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy Wants Cancer Warning on Alcohol

Date: Not mentioned in the article
Source: Indian Express

US Surgeon-General Vivek Murthy has called for alcoholic beverages to carry cancer warning labels, highlighting evidence that no level of alcohol consumption is safe when it comes to cancer risk.

  • Alcohol is the third leading preventable cause of cancer in the US, following tobacco and obesity.
  • Consumption of just one drink per day can increase the risk for several cancers including breast, mouth, and throat.
  • Alcohol is classified as a group 1 carcinogen by the WHO, with no safe level of consumption.
  • Dr Murthy's report states alcohol increases the risk of at least seven types of cancer.
  • Dr Murthy draws parallels with India's anti-smoking campaigns as a model for addressing alcohol-related harm.
“Alcohol has been confirmed as a group 1 carcinogen... there is no safe level of alcohol,” - Dr Pankaj Chaturvedi

This initiative reflects a growing recognition of the health risks associated with alcohol consumption and aims to reduce the incidence of alcohol-related cancers.

item.title: India protests China’s ‘new counties’ in the Hotan Prefecture that incorporates territory of Ladakh - The Hindu
item.description:
India Protests China's New Counties in Hotan Prefecture Affected Ladakh

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: The Hindu

India has lodged a solemn protest with China over the formation of two counties in the Hotan Prefecture that incorporates parts of Ladakh. The Ministry of External Affairs has asserted India's position on its sovereignty over these territories.

  • India protested against China's formation of He’an County and Hekang County in Hotan Prefecture.
  • Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal emphasized India's non-acceptance of China's territorial claims.
  • Concerns raised over a Chinese hydro project impacting the Brahmaputra river.
  • The protest comes after a significant meeting between Indian and Chinese representatives regarding border tensions.
  • The announcement of the world's largest dam by China further complicates the situation.
“Creation of new counties will neither have a bearing on India’s long-standing and consistent position regarding our sovereignty over the area nor lend legitimacy to China’s illegal and forcible occupation.” - Randhir Jaiswal

India will continue to monitor developments and take measures to protect its interests in the region as tensions remain high.

item.title: 7 stunning images of star cluster captured by NASA - India.com
item.description:
7 Stunning Images of Star Cluster Captured by NASA

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: India.com

This article showcases seven mesmerizing images of star clusters taken by NASA, highlighting their beauty and scientific significance.

  • Westerlund 2, a massive cluster of 3,000 stars in the stellar nursery Gum 29.
  • Caldwell 71, an open cluster with loosely bound stars.
  • NGC 1850, a globular cluster located in the Large Magellanic Cloud.
  • Liller 1, a star cluster over 11 billion years old.
  • Terzan 4, featuring hot blue stars in the center and cooler red stars on the edges.
  • Trumpler 14, hosting some of the galaxy's most massive and luminous stars.
  • The Arches star cluster depicted from within the Milky Way.
This NASA image shows Westerlund 2, a massive cluster in the turbulent stellar nursery Gum 29.

These images not only display the breathtaking beauty of the universe but also contribute to our understanding of stellar evolution and the composition of galaxies.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: IND's early momentum dies out as Smith, Webster calm things down for AUS - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: Bumrah off the field, Kohli leading IND early in 2nd session

Date: [Date not provided] Source: Hindustan Times

The live action continues as India faces Australia in the 5th Test, with significant stakes for both teams. After losing key wickets, India aims to maintain pressure on the Australian batting lineup.

  • India started strong, with Bumrah dismissing Labuschagne and Siraj following up with key wickets.
  • At Lunch, Australia was 101/5, trailing by 84 runs.
  • The conditions at SCG favor pace bowlers, making it a challenging day for batters.
  • Ongoing controversies include Rohit Sharma's absence from the squad due to form issues.
Rohit Sharma stated, “I am not getting runs. No guarantee that it will be the same a few months later.”

This Test is crucial, as it affects future championships for both teams.

item.title: Who is Mike Johnson, new US House Speaker re-elected amid Republican dissent? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who is Mike Johnson, new US House Speaker re-elected amid Republican dissent?

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

US House Speaker Mike Johnson was reelected amid Republican dissent, securing his position with 218 votes after intense negotiations. His reelection is bolstered by support from President-elect Donald Trump.

  • Mike Johnson narrowly overcame hard-right GOP opposition.
  • He represents Louisiana's 4th Congressional District and is known for his conservative views.
  • His leadership aligns with a broader GOP agenda focused on reducing government size.
  • Trump endorsed Johnson during the vote.
  • Johnson's previous election came after a historic removal of former Speaker Kevin McCarthy.
“Mike will be a Great Speaker, and our Country will be the beneficiary,” Trump posted on social media.

Johnson's reelection signals ongoing divisions within the GOP but also reflects strategic party support from influential figures like Trump.

item.title: Sam Konstas slammed for altercation with Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
Sam Konstas Faces Criticism for Heated Exchange with Jasprit Bumrah

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

Australian opener Sam Konstas has come under fire for a heated argument with India captain Jasprit Bumrah during the SCG Test.

  • Konstas engaged in a furious exchange with Bumrah before Usman Khawaja's dismissal.
  • The altercation led to India celebrating Khawaja's wicket and marked a tense finale to day one.
  • Reports suggest Konstas' behavior may have distracted Khawaja from finishing the day's play smoothly.
  • Adam Gilchrist criticized Konstas, highlighting the unusual and intense nature of the celebration from the Indian team.
"They're charging in from everywhere … All sorts of drama here," said Adam Gilchrist. "It was Bumrah who turned to Konstas. He learns a tough lesson in his second Test match."

The incident has sparked widespread discussion and criticism among commentators and former players regarding the balance between confidence and unsportsmanlike conduct.

item.description:
Bachchan Family Returns to Mumbai After New Year Celebration

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Bachchan family welcomed the New Year away from Mumbai and were spotted returning to the city at the airport.

  • Abhishek Bachchan wore a grey hoodie and black tracks, showcasing comfort.
  • Aishwarya Rai was stylish in a black sweatshirt and leggings.
  • Aaradhya Bachchan wore a cheerful blue sweatshirt and grey tracks.
  • The family warmly interacted with paparazzi upon their arrival.
  • Veteran actors Amitabh and Jaya Bachchan also returned from a New Year getaway.
“Aishwarya, Aaradhya Twin In Black; Fans Troll 'Absentee Father' Abhishek Bachchan”

The Bachchan family has been active in public events lately, including a wedding and a school function for Aaradhya.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs north India, flight operations at Delhi airport hit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog has severely impacted flight operations at Delhi International Airport, leading to a halt in departures and arrivals. Visibility was reduced to zero, affecting not only air travel but also road traffic across Delhi and neighboring states.

  • Flight operations at Delhi airport were significantly disrupted due to dense fog.
  • IndiGo announced a temporary halt on all flights due to visibility issues.
  • Air India reported similar disruptions affecting northern India.
  • More than 400 flights were delayed as a consequence of the weather conditions.
  • The visibility at Indira Gandhi International Airport was recorded at 0 meters.
"Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," DIAL posted.

The article highlights the significant impact of weather conditions on travel plans, with authorities advising passengers to stay informed about flight statuses.

item.title: No jail time for Donald Trump? Hush money sentencing set for this date - Hindustan Times
item.description:
No jail time for Donald Trump? Hush money sentencing set for this date

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A judge has set Donald Trump's sentencing in his hush money case for January 10, indicating he is unlikely to receive jail time, despite facing conviction.

  • The judge, Juan M. Merchan, will sentence Trump just before he returns to the White House on January 20.
  • Trump is set to become the first president to take office while convicted of a felony.
  • Merchan dismissed Trump's appeal to overturn the verdict, citing no legal impediment to proceeding with the sentencing.
  • The case revolves around payments made to silence allegations from Stormy Daniels during the 2016 campaign.
“Only by bringing finality to this matter will the interests of justice be served.” - Judge Juan M. Merchan

The ruling is significant as it affects Trump's ability to maneuver politically ahead of his inauguration, raising questions about the broader implications of legal challenges for elected officials.

item.title: Donald Trump hush money trial: Judge sets sentencing for January 10, signals no jail time - The Hindu
item.description:
Judge Sets Sentencing for Donald Trump Hush Money Case for January 10, Indicates No Jail Time

Publication Date: January 04, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

In an extraordinary turn, a judge set President-elect Donald Trump's sentencing in his hush money case for January 10, signaling that he would likely not face jail time despite being the first president to take office with a felony conviction.

  • The judge indicated the possibility of a conditional discharge.
  • Trump was convicted of 34 counts of falsifying business records related to hush money paid to Stormy Daniels.
  • Proceeds of the trial were paused after Trump’s election but have resumed.
“Only by bringing finality to this matter will the interests of justice be served,” said Judge Merchan.

Trump faces a range of potential punishments, highlighting the complex intersection of politics and legal accountability.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Indian captain Jasprit Bumrah celebrated aggressively after dismissing Australian opener Usman Khawaja during the fifth India-Australia Test at Sydney Cricket Ground. The video of his celebration has gone viral on social media.

  • Khawaja was dismissed for 2 runs off 10 balls on the last ball of Day 1.
  • Bumrah's celebration was directed towards Sam Konstas after grabbing Khawaja's wicket.
  • This wicket marked Bumrah's 31st dismissal in the series, equaling Bishan Singh Bedi's record.
Bumrah has matched former great Bishan Singh Bedi's record of 31 wickets in Test series played in Australia.

If Bumrah secures one more wicket during the ongoing match, he will hold the record for the most wickets in an India-Australia Test series.

item.title: Rohit Sharma Told He's Not In BCCI Selectors' Test Plans, Chat With Virat Kohli Soon: Report - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Excluded from BCCI Test Plans, Future Uncertain

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Rohit Sharma has reportedly been informed by BCCI selectors that he is no longer part of their plans for future Test matches. This decision follows his absence from the Indian squad for the final Test against Australia.

  • Rohit has not played since the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne.
  • The selectors met to discuss the team’s future, and Rohit’s exclusion seems unanimous.
  • Virat Kohli’s future will also be discussed after the ongoing match in Sydney.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is anticipated to lead the team in Rohit's absence if India qualifies for the 2025 World Test Championship Final.
“Obviously, our captain has shown his leadership as well. He’s opted to rest in this game. So that shows that there’s a lot of unity in our team.” - Jasprit Bumrah

The Boxing Day Test may have been Rohit Sharma's last appearance in whites for India as discussions on team strategy shift with an eye towards future tournaments.

item.title: Kamala Harris seemingly botches the Pledge of Allegiance: Critics take a dig at ‘her most embarrassing moment yet’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kamala Harris seemingly botches the Pledge of Allegiance: Critics take a dig at ‘her most embarrassing moment yet’

Publication Date: January 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Vice President Kamala Harris found herself at the center of criticism after appearing to fumble the Pledge of Allegiance during the swearing-in of new senators. The incident quickly went viral, sparking debate and ridicule online.

  • Conservative critics highlighted her apparent inability to recite the Pledge correctly during a crucial moment in the Senate.
  • Harris began the pledge confidently but faltered midway, omitting key phrases.
  • The event was broadcasted widely, amplifying the backlash against her.
  • Notable figures in conservative media expressed their discontent and shared clips online.
“Kamala Harris appears to forget the Pledge of Allegiance during the swearing-in ceremony for new senators. This woman is a heartbeat away from being the president.” - Collin Rugg

The incident has led to widespread ridicule and has become a focal point for critics of Harris, suggesting that it may adversely affect her public perception.

item.title: Mike Johnson elected speaker of US House as Republicans unite behind him - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mike Johnson elected speaker of US House as Republicans unite behind him

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Mike Johnson was reelected as Speaker of the US House of Representatives after overcoming initial opposition in a closely contested vote. This election underlines the divisions within the Republican party and the challenges faced by the newly re-elected speaker.

  • Johnson won reelection with 218 votes, the minimum needed, amid negotiations with Republican opponents.
  • The current Republican majority stands at a thin margin of 219-215.
  • Johnson’s election was a key test of the party's ability to unify under Trump's leadership.
  • He has faced challenges maintaining party support due to prior reliance on Democratic votes for legislation.
  • Significant upcoming issues include addressing the national debt ceiling and implementing Trump's legislative agenda.
Trump stated, "A win for Mike today will be a big win for the Republican Party."

Mike Johnson's election as Speaker represents a critical moment for the Republican party as it seeks to navigate internal divisions and legislative challenges ahead.

item.title: EPA Completes Final TSCA Risk Evaluation for Formaldehyde - Powder Bulk Solids
item.description:
EPA Completes Final TSCA Risk Evaluation for Formaldehyde

Date: October 2023 Source: EPA

The EPA has determined that formaldehyde presents an unreasonable risk of injury to human health based on its final TSCA risk evaluation.

  • EPA identified risks associated with acute and chronic exposure to formaldehyde.
  • It stated that not all risks apply universally.
  • Short-term exposure can cause sensory irritation, while long-term exposure is linked to more severe health risks.
  • The agency notes that formaldehyde is unlikely to contaminate drinking water.
  • The evaluation affects various industries handling formaldehyde and related products.
“EPA concludes that virtually all conditions of use contribute to ‘unreasonable risk’ under TSCA.”

In conclusion, the ruling raises concerns from the American Chemistry Council about its implications on domestic production and critical American industries.

item.title: Is BTS’s V Joining “Squid Game 3?” Lead Actors Respond To The Rumors - Koreaboo
item.description:
Is BTS's V Joining 'Squid Game 3?' Lead Actors Respond To The Rumors

Publication Date: 2 hours ago | Source: Koreaboo

Fans speculate on whether BTS's V will appear in the upcoming third season of Netflix's hit series Squid Game, especially after rumors grew following interactions between V and key cast members.

  • The second season of Squid Game premiered on December 26 with new characters.
  • Speculation arises due to V's prior masked guard cosplay during BTS concerts.
  • Netizens anticipate more character reveals as Season 3 is confirmed.
  • Netflix accidentally revealed the possible release date for Season 3 as June 27, 2025.

“I can’t say anything about that.” - Lee Jung Jae

While no official comments have been made, the ambiguous responses from the cast fuel the excitement among fans.

item.title: Are Covid-19 and herpes viruses silently triggering Alzheimer's and other brain diseases - The Times of India
item.description:
Are Covid-19 and herpes viruses silently triggering Alzheimer's and other brain diseases

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

This article explores the potential link between Covid-19 and herpes viruses in relation to Alzheimer's and various brain diseases. Researchers suggest that these viruses may play a role in the onset and progression of neurodegenerative conditions.

  • The ongoing research investigates how Covid-19 and herpes may impact brain health.
  • Findings indicate a possible correlation between viral infections and Alzheimer's disease.
  • Experts emphasize the need for further studies to establish a direct connection.
  • Public health implications are significant, considering the prevalence of these viruses.
"The interaction between viruses and the nervous system could open new avenues for treatment and prevention of brain diseases." - Neurologist

This article highlights crucial concerns about viral contributions to brain diseases and underscores the necessity for ongoing research in this area.

item.title: Video of Kamala Harris fumbling on the Pledge of Allegiance goes viral. Social media users left in shock - The Times of India
item.description:
Video of Kamala Harris fumbling on the Pledge of Allegiance goes viral

Date & Source: October 20, 2023 | Times of India

Vice President Kamala Harris recently faced backlash after a video surfaced showing her fumbling through the Pledge of Allegiance during a public event. This moment has left social media users in shock, quickly going viral and sparking discussions about public performance and political gaffes.

  • The video shows Harris struggling to recall the words of the Pledge.
  • It has gained thousands of shares and reactions on various social media platforms.
  • Critics are questioning her preparedness and public speaking skills.
  • Supporters however are defending her, stating everyone can have off moments.
“Even a seasoned politician can have a slip-up, it's part of being human.” - Social Media User

The incident illustrates the heightened scrutiny on public figures and the impact of social media in shaping narratives around political figures.

item.title: Did Kamala Harris fumble on the Pledge of Allegiance? '2 bottles of wine deep at noon' - The Times of India
item.description:
Video of Kamala Harris fumbling on the Pledge of Allegiance goes viral

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not specified

An unsettling video showing Vice President Kamala Harris fumbling during the Pledge of Allegiance has become a viral sensation, leaving many social media users in shock.

  • Video footage captures Kamala Harris struggling with the words of the Pledge.
  • The incident has prompted significant discussion and debate online.
  • Responses vary, with some finding humor in the situation while others express concern.
“It’s not just a slip of the tongue; it raises questions about attention and focus during public addresses.”

This viral moment highlights the intense scrutiny public figures face in the age of social media.

item.title: PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses' - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses'

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated several projects in Delhi, including educational institutions and housing initiatives, while criticizing Arvind Kejriwal’s government.

  • Foundation stone laid for Veer Savarkar College at Najafgarh.
  • Inauguration of the World Trade Centre at Nauroji Nagar and GPRA Type-II Quarters.
  • Implementation of In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project for Jhuggi Jhopri dwellers.
  • PM Modi emphasized on improving the living conditions for the poor.
  • Criticism aimed at AAP for neglecting education and urban issues in Delhi.

“The people of Delhi have waged a war against this ‘aapda’. Voters of Delhi have made up their minds to free Delhi from this ‘aapda’.”

PM Modi’s launch of various development projects reflects his commitment to enhancing living standards in Delhi, while his political rivalry with Kejriwal intensifies ahead of upcoming elections.

item.title: ‘Nothing to be alarmed about’: Centre on China HMPV outbreak - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Nothing to be alarmed about': Centre on China HMPV outbreak

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Union health ministry has addressed concerns regarding a potential outbreak of the human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in China, affirming that there has been no significant increase in viral respiratory illness cases.

  • The health ministry stated there’s “no substantial increase” in respiratory illness cases.
  • Dr. Atul Goel emphasized the commonality of the virus, akin to any other respiratory virus.
  • Monitoring of both seasonal influenza and respiratory cases is ongoing.
  • Precautionary measures against spread are advised for respiratory infections.
“There is nothing to be alarmed about in the present situation,” said Dr. Goel.

In summary, officials maintain that while attention to HMPV is warranted, the public can remain calm as the healthcare system is prepared and no alarming rise in cases has been noted.

item.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eases on Friday as investors look elsewhere - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD Dips Below $2,650 as Market Sentiment Shifts

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

XAU/USD dipped on Friday, with gold prices falling roughly two-thirds of a percent and dipping back below $2,650 per ounce as market sentiment recovers from the early week’s risk-off appetite.

  • Gold bids cooled back below $2,650, crimping the week’s gains.
  • Market risk appetite recovered with improved US ISM data.
  • Federal Reserve's Barkin soothes investor concerns on interest rates and tariffs.
“Markets shouldn’t be too worried about a potential 10%-20% fee on all imported goods into the US.” - Tom Barkin

With upcoming economic events like the Nonfarm Payrolls print, market participants are closely watching how gold prices will react to broader economic trends.

item.title: Congress convenes for House speaker vote: Mike Johnson's re-election up for contention; what happens next - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Begins Speaker Vote with Mike Johnson's Future at Stake

Published on: January 3, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

The 119th Congress has convened for the first time, and House Speaker Mike Johnson is fighting for his political future as his re-election hangs in the balance amid pressure from far-right Republicans and Democratic opposition.

  • The House is currently voting for the Speaker, an essential role that must be filled to allow Congress to function.
  • Johnson secured the Republican nomination but faces challenges from dissenting party members.
  • In a close majority of 220-215, Johnson needs nearly every Republican's support to remain in power.
  • The voting process is long and involves individual calls from members, unlike a simple ballot.
  • Johnson is backed by President-elect Donald Trump, who emphasized the importance of a win for the Republican Party.
“I hope so. We’ll see,” Mike Johnson said about his chances of winning the speakership during the first round of voting.

As the campaign for the speakership unfolds, the dynamics within the House remain tense, with implications for Trump’s agenda and the future of the Republican Party.
